1534
1535class MrviewOutputs(typing.NamedTuple):
1536    """
1537    Output object returned when calling `mrview(...)`.
1538    """
1539    root: OutputPathType
1540    """Output root folder. This is the root folder for all outputs."""
1541
1542
1543def mrview(
1544    mode: list[MrviewMode] | None = None,
1545    load: list[MrviewLoad] | None = None,
1546    reset: list[MrviewReset] | None = None,
1547    fov: list[MrviewFov] | None = None,
1548    focus: list[MrviewFocus] | None = None,
1549    target: list[MrviewTarget] | None = None,
1550    voxel: list[MrviewVoxel] | None = None,
1551    volume: list[MrviewVolume] | None = None,
1552    plane: list[MrviewPlane] | None = None,
1553    lock: list[MrviewLock] | None = None,
1554    select_image: list[MrviewSelectImage] | None = None,
1555    autoscale: list[MrviewAutoscale] | None = None,
1556    interpolation: list[MrviewInterpolation] | None = None,
1557    colourmap: list[MrviewColourmap] | None = None,
1558    noannotations: list[MrviewNoannotations] | None = None,
1559    comments: list[MrviewComments] | None = None,
1560    voxelinfo: list[MrviewVoxelinfo] | None = None,
1561    orientationlabel: list[MrviewOrientationlabel] | None = None,
1562    colourbar: list[MrviewColourbar] | None = None,

1599    connectome_init: InputPathType | None = None,
1600    connectome_load: list[MrviewConnectomeLoad] | None = None,
1601    capture_folder: list[MrviewCaptureFolder] | None = None,
1602    capture_prefix: list[MrviewCapturePrefix] | None = None,
1603    capture_grab: list[MrviewCaptureGrab] | None = None,
1604    info: bool = False,
1605    quiet: bool = False,
1606    debug: bool = False,
1607    force: bool = False,
1608    nthreads: int | None = None,
1609    config: list[MrviewConfig] | None = None,
1610    help_: bool = False,
1611    version: bool = False,
1612    image: list[InputPathType] | None = None,
1613    runner: Runner | None = None,
1614) -> MrviewOutputs:
1615    """
1616    The MRtrix image viewer.
1617    
1618    Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the
1619    image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent
1620    command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had
1621    been performed through the GUI.
1622    
1623    Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the
1624    command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be
1625    performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last
1626    argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which
1627    image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or
1628    -select_image options. For example:
1629    
1630    $ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0
1631    
1632    or
1633    
1634    $ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2
1635    -interpolation 0
1636    
1637    References:
1638    
1639    Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography
1640    in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66.
1641    
1642    Author: J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt
1643    (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au),
1644    Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch
1645    (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander
1646    (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com)
1647    
1648    URL: https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/commands/mrview.html
1649    
1650    Args:
1651        mode: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the\
1652            view menu.
1653        load: Load image specified and make it current.
1654        reset: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV,\
1655            projection and focus.
1656        fov: Set the field of view, in mm.
1657        focus: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner\
1658            coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list\
1659            of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a\
1660            boolean value as argument.
1661        target: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner\
1662            coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window.
1663        voxel: Set the position of the crosshairs in voxel coordinates,\
1664            relative the image currently displayed. The new position should be\
1665            supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values.
1666        volume: Set the volume index for the image displayed, as a\
1667            comma-separated list of integers.
1668        plane: Set the viewing plane, according to the mappping 0: sagittal; 1:\
1669            coronal; 2: axial.
1670        lock: Set whether view is locked to image axes (0: no, 1: yes).
1671        select_image: Switch to image number specified, with reference to the\
1672            list of currently loaded images.
1673        autoscale: Reset the image scaling to automatically determined range.
1674        interpolation: Enable or disable image interpolation in main image.
1675        colourmap: Switch the image colourmap to that specified, as per the\
1676            colourmap menu.
1677        noannotations: Hide all image annotation overlays.
1678        comments: Show or hide image comments overlay.
1679        voxelinfo: Show or hide voxel information overlay.
1680        orientationlabel: Show or hide orientation label overlay.
1681        colourbar: Show or hide colourbar overlay.
1682        imagevisible: Show or hide the main image.
1683        intensity_range: Set the image intensity range to that specified.
1684        size: Set the size of the view area, in pixel units.
1685        position: Set the position of the main window, in pixel units.
1686        fullscreen: Start fullscreen.
1687        exit_: Quit MRView.
1688        sync_focus: Sync the focus with other MRView windows that also have\
1689            this turned on.
1690        fps: Display frames per second, averaged over the last 10 frames. The\
1691            maximum over the last 3 seconds is also displayed.
1692        overlay_load: Loads the specified image on the overlay tool.
1693        overlay_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1694        overlay_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the overlay as indexed in the\
1695            colourmap dropdown menu.
1696        overlay_colour: Specify a manual colour for the overlay, as three\
1697            comma-separated values.
1698        overlay_intensity: Set the intensity windowing of the overlay.
1699        overlay_threshold_min: Set the lower threshold value of the overlay.
1700        overlay_threshold_max: Set the upper threshold value of the overlay.
1701        overlay_no_threshold_min: Disable the lower threshold for the overlay.
1702        overlay_no_threshold_max: Disable the upper threshold for the overlay.
1703        overlay_interpolation: Enable or disable overlay image interpolation.
1704        roi_load: Loads the specified image on the ROI editor tool.
1705        roi_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1706        roi_colour: Sets the colour of the ROI overlay.
1707        tractography_load: Load the specified tracks file into the tractography\
1708            tool.
1709        tractography_thickness: Line thickness of tractography display, [-1.0,\
1710            1.0], default is 0.0.
1711        tractography_geometry: The geometry type to use when rendering\
1712            tractograms (options are: pseudotubes, lines, points).
1713        tractography_opacity: Opacity of tractography display, [0.0, 1.0],\
1714            default is 1.0.
1715        tractography_slab: Slab thickness of tractography display, in mm. -1 to\
1716            turn off crop to slab.
1717        tractography_lighting: Toggle the use of lighting of tractogram\
1718            geometry.
1719        tractography_colour: Specify a manual colour for the tractogram, as\
1720            three comma-separated values.
1721        tractography_tsf_load: Load the specified tractography scalar file.
1722        tractography_tsf_range: Set range for the tractography scalar file.\
1723            Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1724        tractography_tsf_thresh: Set thresholds for the tractography scalar\
1725            file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1726        tractography_tsf_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the .tsf file as\
1727            indexed in the tsf colourmap dropdown menu. Requires\
1728            -tractography.tsf_load already.
1729        odf_load_sh: Loads the specified SH-based ODF image on the ODF tool.
1730        odf_load_tensor: Loads the specified tensor image on the ODF tool.
1731        odf_load_dixel: Loads the specified dixel-based image on the ODF tool.
1732        fixel_load: Load a fixel file (any file inside a fixel directory, or an\
1733            old .msf / .msh legacy format file) into the fixel tool.
1734        connectome_init: Initialise the connectome tool using a parcellation\
1735            image.
1736        connectome_load: Load a matrix file into the connectome tool.
1737        capture_folder: Set the output folder for the screen capture tool.
1738        capture_prefix: Set the output file prefix for the screen capture tool.
1739        capture_grab: Start the screen capture process.
1740        info: display information messages.
1741        quiet: do not display information messages or progress status;\
1742            alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET\
1743            environment variable to a non-empty string.
1744        debug: display debugging messages.
1745        force: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as\
1746            input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
1747        nthreads: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications\
1748            (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
1749        config: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
1750        help_: display this information page and exit.
1751        version: display version information and exit.
1752        image: An image to be loaded.
1753        runner: Command runner.
1754    Returns:
1755        NamedTuple of outputs (described in `MrviewOutputs`).
1756    """
1757    runner = runner or get_global_runner()
1758    execution = runner.start_execution(MRVIEW_METADATA)
1759    cargs = []
1760    cargs.append("mrview")
1761    if mode is not None:
1762        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in mode] for a in c])
1763    if load is not None:
1764        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in load] for a in c])
1765    if reset is not None:
1766        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in reset] for a in c])
1767    if fov is not None:
1768        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in fov] for a in c])
1769    if focus is not None:
1770        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in focus] for a in c])
1771    if target is not None:
1772        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in target] for a in c])
1773    if voxel is not None:
1774        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in voxel] for a in c])
1775    if volume is not None:
1776        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in volume] for a in c])
1777    if plane is not None:
1778        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in plane] for a in c])
1779    if lock is not None:
1780        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in lock] for a in c])
1781    if select_image is not None:
1782        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in select_image] for a in c])
1783    if autoscale is not None:
1784        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in autoscale] for a in c])
1785    if interpolation is not None:
1786        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in interpolation] for a in c])
1787    if colourmap is not None:
1788        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in colourmap] for a in c])
1789    if noannotations is not None:
1790        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in noannotations] for a in c])
1791    if comments is not None:
1792        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in comments] for a in c])
1793    if voxelinfo is not None:
1794        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in voxelinfo] for a in c])
1795    if orientationlabel is not None:
1796        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in orientationlabel] for a in c])
1797    if colourbar is not None:
1798        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in colourbar] for a in c])
1799    if imagevisible is not None:
1800        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in imagevisible] for a in c])

1612    version: bool = False,
1613    image: list[InputPathType] | None = None,
1614    runner: Runner | None = None,
1615) -> MrviewOutputs:
1616    """
1617    The MRtrix image viewer.
1618    
1619    Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the
1620    image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent
1621    command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had
1622    been performed through the GUI.
1623    
1624    Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the
1625    command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be
1626    performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last
1627    argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which
1628    image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or
1629    -select_image options. For example:
1630    
1631    $ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0
1632    
1633    or
1634    
1635    $ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2
1636    -interpolation 0
1637    
1638    References:
1639    
1640    Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography
1641    in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66.
1642    
1643    Author: J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt
1644    (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au),
1645    Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch
1646    (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander
1647    (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com)
1648    
1649    URL: https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/commands/mrview.html
1650    
1651    Args:
1652        mode: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the\
1653            view menu.
1654        load: Load image specified and make it current.
1655        reset: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV,\
1656            projection and focus.
1657        fov: Set the field of view, in mm.
1658        focus: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner\
1659            coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list\
1660            of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a\
1661            boolean value as argument.
1662        target: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner\
1663            coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window.
1664        voxel: Set the position of the crosshairs in voxel coordinates,\
1665            relative the image currently displayed. The new position should be\
1666            supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values.
1667        volume: Set the volume index for the image displayed, as a\
1668            comma-separated list of integers.
1669        plane: Set the viewing plane, according to the mappping 0: sagittal; 1:\
1670            coronal; 2: axial.
1671        lock: Set whether view is locked to image axes (0: no, 1: yes).
1672        select_image: Switch to image number specified, with reference to the\
1673            list of currently loaded images.
1674        autoscale: Reset the image scaling to automatically determined range.
1675        interpolation: Enable or disable image interpolation in main image.
1676        colourmap: Switch the image colourmap to that specified, as per the\
1677            colourmap menu.
1678        noannotations: Hide all image annotation overlays.
1679        comments: Show or hide image comments overlay.
1680        voxelinfo: Show or hide voxel information overlay.
1681        orientationlabel: Show or hide orientation label overlay.
1682        colourbar: Show or hide colourbar overlay.
1683        imagevisible: Show or hide the main image.
1684        intensity_range: Set the image intensity range to that specified.
1685        size: Set the size of the view area, in pixel units.
1686        position: Set the position of the main window, in pixel units.
1687        fullscreen: Start fullscreen.
1688        exit_: Quit MRView.
1689        sync_focus: Sync the focus with other MRView windows that also have\
1690            this turned on.
1691        fps: Display frames per second, averaged over the last 10 frames. The\
1692            maximum over the last 3 seconds is also displayed.
1693        overlay_load: Loads the specified image on the overlay tool.
1694        overlay_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1695        overlay_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the overlay as indexed in the\
1696            colourmap dropdown menu.
1697        overlay_colour: Specify a manual colour for the overlay, as three\
1698            comma-separated values.
1699        overlay_intensity: Set the intensity windowing of the overlay.
1700        overlay_threshold_min: Set the lower threshold value of the overlay.
1701        overlay_threshold_max: Set the upper threshold value of the overlay.
1702        overlay_no_threshold_min: Disable the lower threshold for the overlay.
1703        overlay_no_threshold_max: Disable the upper threshold for the overlay.
1704        overlay_interpolation: Enable or disable overlay image interpolation.
1705        roi_load: Loads the specified image on the ROI editor tool.
1706        roi_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1707        roi_colour: Sets the colour of the ROI overlay.
1708        tractography_load: Load the specified tracks file into the tractography\
1709            tool.
1710        tractography_thickness: Line thickness of tractography display, [-1.0,\
1711            1.0], default is 0.0.
1712        tractography_geometry: The geometry type to use when rendering\
1713            tractograms (options are: pseudotubes, lines, points).
1714        tractography_opacity: Opacity of tractography display, [0.0, 1.0],\
1715            default is 1.0.
1716        tractography_slab: Slab thickness of tractography display, in mm. -1 to\
1717            turn off crop to slab.
1718        tractography_lighting: Toggle the use of lighting of tractogram\
1719            geometry.
1720        tractography_colour: Specify a manual colour for the tractogram, as\
1721            three comma-separated values.
1722        tractography_tsf_load: Load the specified tractography scalar file.
1723        tractography_tsf_range: Set range for the tractography scalar file.\
1724            Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1725        tractography_tsf_thresh: Set thresholds for the tractography scalar\
1726            file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1727        tractography_tsf_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the .tsf file as\
1728            indexed in the tsf colourmap dropdown menu. Requires\
1729            -tractography.tsf_load already.
1730        odf_load_sh: Loads the specified SH-based ODF image on the ODF tool.
1731        odf_load_tensor: Loads the specified tensor image on the ODF tool.
1732        odf_load_dixel: Loads the specified dixel-based image on the ODF tool.
1733        fixel_load: Load a fixel file (any file inside a fixel directory, or an\
1734            old .msf / .msh legacy format file) into the fixel tool.
1735        connectome_init: Initialise the connectome tool using a parcellation\
1736            image.
1737        connectome_load: Load a matrix file into the connectome tool.
1738        capture_folder: Set the output folder for the screen capture tool.
1739        capture_prefix: Set the output file prefix for the screen capture tool.
1740        capture_grab: Start the screen capture process.
1741        info: display information messages.
1742        quiet: do not display information messages or progress status;\
1743            alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET\
1744            environment variable to a non-empty string.
1745        debug: display debugging messages.
1746        force: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as\
1747            input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
1748        nthreads: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications\
1749            (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
1750        config: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
1751        help_: display this information page and exit.
1752        version: display version information and exit.
1753        image: An image to be loaded.
1754        runner: Command runner.
1755    Returns:
1756        NamedTuple of outputs (described in `MrviewOutputs`).
1757    """
1758    runner = runner or get_global_runner()
1759    execution = runner.start_execution(MRVIEW_METADATA)
1760    cargs = []
1761    cargs.append("mrview")
1762    if mode is not None:
1763        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in mode] for a in c])
1764    if load is not None:
1765        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in load] for a in c])
1766    if reset is not None:
1767        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in reset] for a in c])
1768    if fov is not None:
1769        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in fov] for a in c])
1770    if focus is not None:
1771        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in focus] for a in c])
1772    if target is not None:
1773        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in target] for a in c])
1774    if voxel is not None:
1775        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in voxel] for a in c])
1776    if volume is not None:
1777        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in volume] for a in c])
1778    if plane is not None:
1779        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in plane] for a in c])
1780    if lock is not None:
1781        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in lock] for a in c])
1782    if select_image is not None:
1783        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in select_image] for a in c])
1784    if autoscale is not None:
1785        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in autoscale] for a in c])
1786    if interpolation is not None:
1787        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in interpolation] for a in c])
1788    if colourmap is not None:
1789        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in colourmap] for a in c])
1790    if noannotations is not None:
1791        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in noannotations] for a in c])
1792    if comments is not None:
1793        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in comments] for a in c])
1794    if voxelinfo is not None:
1795        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in voxelinfo] for a in c])
1796    if orientationlabel is not None:
1797        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in orientationlabel] for a in c])
1798    if colourbar is not None:
1799        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in colourbar] for a in c])
1800    if imagevisible is not None:
1801        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in imagevisible] for a in c])
1802    if intensity_range is not None:
1803        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in intensity_range] for a in c])
1804    if size is not None:
1805        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in size] for a in c])
1806    if position is not None:
1807        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in position] for a in c])
1808    if fullscreen:
1809        cargs.append("-fullscreen")
1810    if exit_:
1811        cargs.append("-exit")

1816    if overlay_load is not None:

1818    if overlay_opacity is not None:
1819        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in overlay_opacity] for a in c])

1822    if overlay_colour is not None:

1824    if overlay_intensity is not None:
1825        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in overlay_intensity] for a in c])
1826    if overlay_threshold_min is not None:
1827        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in overlay_threshold_min] for a in c])
1828    if overlay_threshold_max is not None:
1829        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in overlay_threshold_max] for a in c])

1870    if fixel_load is not None:

1872    if connectome_init is not None:
1873        cargs.extend([
1874            "-connectome.init",
1875            execution.input_file(connectome_init)
1876        ])
1877    if connectome_load is not None:
1878        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in connectome_load] for a in c])
1879    if capture_folder is not None:
1880        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in capture_folder] for a in c])
1881    if capture_prefix is not None:
1882        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in capture_prefix] for a in c])
1883    if capture_grab is not None:
1884        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in capture_grab] for a in c])
1885    if info:
1886        cargs.append("-info")
1887    if quiet:
1888        cargs.append("-quiet")
1889    if debug:
1890        cargs.append("-debug")
1891    if force:
1892        cargs.append("-force")
1893    if nthreads is not None:
1894        cargs.extend([
1895            "-nthreads",
1896            str(nthreads)
1897        ])
1898    if config is not None:
1899        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in config] for a in c])
1900    if help_:
1901        cargs.append("-help")
1902    if version:
1903        cargs.append("-version")
1904    if image is not None:
1905        cargs.extend([execution.input_file(f) for f in image])
1906    ret = MrviewOutputs(
1907        root=execution.output_file("."),
1908    )
1909    execution.run(cargs)
1910    return ret

The MRtrix image viewer.

Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had been performed through the GUI.

Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or -select_image options. For example:

$ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0

or

$ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2 -interpolation 0

References:

Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66.

Author: J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au), Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com)

URL: https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/commands/mrview.html

Arguments:
  • mode: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the view menu.
  • load: Load image specified and make it current.
  • reset: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV, projection and focus.
  • fov: Set the field of view, in mm.
  • focus: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a boolean value as argument.
  • target: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window.
  • voxel: Set the position of the crosshairs in voxel coordinates, relative the image currently displayed. The new position should be supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values.
  • volume: Set the volume index for the image displayed, as a comma-separated list of integers.
  • plane: Set the viewing plane, according to the mappping 0: sagittal; 1: coronal; 2: axial.
  • lock: Set whether view is locked to image axes (0: no, 1: yes).
  • select_image: Switch to image number specified, with reference to the list of currently loaded images.
  • autoscale: Reset the image scaling to automatically determined range.
  • interpolation: Enable or disable image interpolation in main image.
  • colourmap: Switch the image colourmap to that specified, as per the colourmap menu.
  • noannotations: Hide all image annotation overlays.
  • comments: Show or hide image comments overlay.
  • voxelinfo: Show or hide voxel information overlay.
  • orientationlabel: Show or hide orientation label overlay.
  • colourbar: Show or hide colourbar overlay.
  • imagevisible: Show or hide the main image.
  • intensity_range: Set the image intensity range to that specified.
  • size: Set the size of the view area, in pixel units.
  • position: Set the position of the main window, in pixel units.
  • fullscreen: Start fullscreen.
  • exit_: Quit MRView.
  • sync_focus: Sync the focus with other MRView windows that also have this turned on.
  • fps: Display frames per second, averaged over the last 10 frames. The maximum over the last 3 seconds is also displayed.
  • overlay_load: Loads the specified image on the overlay tool.
  • overlay_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
  • overlay_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the overlay as indexed in the colourmap dropdown menu.
  • overlay_colour: Specify a manual colour for the overlay, as three comma-separated values.
  • overlay_intensity: Set the intensity windowing of the overlay.
  • overlay_threshold_min: Set the lower threshold value of the overlay.
  • overlay_threshold_max: Set the upper threshold value of the overlay.
  • overlay_no_threshold_min: Disable the lower threshold for the overlay.
  • overlay_no_threshold_max: Disable the upper threshold for the overlay.
  • overlay_interpolation: Enable or disable overlay image interpolation.
  • roi_load: Loads the specified image on the ROI editor tool.
  • roi_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
  • roi_colour: Sets the colour of the ROI overlay.
  • tractography_load: Load the specified tracks file into the tractography tool.
  • tractography_thickness: Line thickness of tractography display, [-1.0, 1.0], default is 0.0.
  • tractography_geometry: The geometry type to use when rendering tractograms (options are: pseudotubes, lines, points).
  • tractography_opacity: Opacity of tractography display, [0.0, 1.0], default is 1.0.
  • tractography_slab: Slab thickness of tractography display, in mm. -1 to turn off crop to slab.
  • tractography_lighting: Toggle the use of lighting of tractogram geometry.
  • tractography_colour: Specify a manual colour for the tractogram, as three comma-separated values.
  • tractography_tsf_load: Load the specified tractography scalar file.
  • tractography_tsf_range: Set range for the tractography scalar file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
  • tractography_tsf_thresh: Set thresholds for the tractography scalar file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
  • tractography_tsf_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the .tsf file as indexed in the tsf colourmap dropdown menu. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already.
  • odf_load_sh: Loads the specified SH-based ODF image on the ODF tool.
  • odf_load_tensor: Loads the specified tensor image on the ODF tool.
  • odf_load_dixel: Loads the specified dixel-based image on the ODF tool.
  • fixel_load: Load a fixel file (any file inside a fixel directory, or an old .msf / .msh legacy format file) into the fixel tool.
  • connectome_init: Initialise the connectome tool using a parcellation image.
  • connectome_load: Load a matrix file into the connectome tool.
  • capture_folder: Set the output folder for the screen capture tool.
  • capture_prefix: Set the output file prefix for the screen capture tool.
  • capture_grab: Start the screen capture process.
  • info: display information messages.
  • quiet: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.
  • debug: display debugging messages.
  • force: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
  • nthreads: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
  • config: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
  • help_: display this information page and exit.
  • version: display version information and exit.
  • image: An image to be loaded.
  • runner: Command runner.
Returns:

NamedTuple of outputs (described in MrviewOutputs).
